source_sentence: 梵摩渝經
translation: Sutra of Brahmā and Yu

source_sentence: 吳月支優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka Zhiqian Translation

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在隨提國，與五百沙門俱行。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was traveling with five hundred ascetics in the country of Śrīti.

source_sentence: 時，有逝心，名梵摩渝，彌夷國人也。
translation: At the time, there was a departed soul named Brahmā'u, a native of the country of Mi'i. He was a hundred and twenty years old and well-versed in the scriptures, stars, and illustrations, and he was planning to meet the tutors of a country he hadn't yet met.

source_sentence: 年在耆艾百有二十，博通眾經星宿圖書，豫覩未萠一國師焉。
translation: He was one hundred and twenty years old, and he was well-versed in all the scriptures, stars, and books, and he was planning to meet one national teacher who hadn't yet gathered.

source_sentence: 梵摩渝遙聞佛王者之子出自釋姓，去國尊榮行作沙門，得道號佛，清淨至尊，與五百沙門處隨提國，開化眾生。
translation: Brahmā and Yogi heard from afar that the son of King Buddha was from the Śākyas, had left the country, honored his practice as an ascetic, attained the name of Buddha, and was a pure supreme being who went with 500 ascetics to the country of Śrīti to enlighten sentient beings.

source_sentence: 梵摩渝深惟歎曰：「沙門瞿曇！
translation: Vāmaṇerī profoundly admired him, saying, "Gautama the ascetic!

source_sentence: 神聖巍巍，為如來、應儀、正真覺、道神通以足、丈夫、尊雄、法御、眾聖、天人之師，心垢已除諸惡已盡，從自覺得無所不知，沙門、逝心、釋、梵、龍、鬼，為其說法，上中下語清淨為首，玄妙卓遠，眾聖所不聞也。」
translation: The gods and sages are so lofty that they are tathāgatas, yōkai, true awakening, supernormal powers of the way, superiors, heroes, Dharma guides, sages, and teachers of gods and humans, have removed mental pollution and ended bad qualities, have attained omniscience from their own awakening, and are taught by ascetics, novices, Śākyamunis, Brahmā, dragons, and ghosts, for whom purity of upper and middle and lower speech is paramount and whose profundity is so subtle and far-reaching that it's unheard by the sages."

source_sentence: 梵摩渝為門徒廣陳之，期為無上正真覺眾聖之王，吾等應為稽首稟化之矣。
translation: Brahmā explained it in detail to his disciples, expecting him to be the unsurpassed, truly enlightened king of sages, so we should all bow our heads and present him with our teachings.

source_sentence: 逝心弟子有亞聖者，厥名摩納，亦博經典，明齊于師，具覩秘讖知當有佛，身相奇特三十有二，至尊難雙貫心照焉。
translation: Among Jiexin's disciples was a sub-sage named Māna, who also knew the scriptures and had knowledge equal to his teacher's and had seen the secret scriptures and knew that there would be a Buddha with thirty or twenty distinctive features, which the most honored and difficult to match penetrated his mind.

source_sentence: 師告摩納：「吾聞瞿曇神聖無上，諸天共宗，獨言隻步眾聖中雄，爾往覩焉。
translation: The teacher told Māṇḍa, "I've heard that the Gautama is a supreme sage, a school shared by the gods, and that he alone says he's the tallest of the sages, so I went to see him.

source_sentence: 宗尊儀表真正弘摸，誠如群儒之所歎不乎？
translation: Isn't the Zongyong's manner truly vast and tactile, just as many scholars have admired?

source_sentence: 假其爾者，吾當馳就稽首奉禮。」
translation: If that's the case, I'll chase after you and bow down to you."

source_sentence: 摩納質曰：「吾當以何觀察？」
translation: Māṇava questioned him, "What will I observe?"

source_sentence: 摩納師曰：「經不云乎！
translation: Master Māṇava said, "Isn't that what the scriptures say!

source_sentence: 來世有王厥名白淨，后名清妙，明德純備，其生聖子有天中天，獨尊之表軀體丈六，相有三十二，處國當為飛行皇帝，捨國為道行作沙門者，必得為佛。」
translation: In a future life, there will be a king whose name will be Baikeung and whose successor's name will be Chingso, a man of pure virtue who will give birth to a noble son who will be a god among gods, a sole honored one whose body will be sixteen cubits in size and whose features will be thirty-two, who will become an emperor of flight in his country, and who will abandon his country for the path and practice as an ascetic and surely will become a buddha."

source_sentence: 摩納受教，稽首師足，至隨提國，即詣佛所，揖讓畢退就坐靜心。
translation: He bowed his head at the feet of his teacher, went to the country of Śrīti, went to the Buddha, bowed his head in respect, and withdrew to sit in meditation.

source_sentence: 熟視佛身相好，不覩兩相，一廣長舌，二陰馬藏，其意有疑。
translation: He looked closely at the Buddha's physical appearance but didn't see two things, a broad and long tongue and a collection of aggregates and horses, and had doubts in his mind.

source_sentence: 佛知摩納心有疑望，即以神足現陰馬藏，出廣長舌以自覆面，左右舐耳縮舌入口，五色光出繞身三匝滅於頂上。
translation: Knowing that Māṇḍa had doubts, the Buddha then manifested the aggregates and the horse store with his spiritual feet, produced a long, broad tongue to cover his face, licked his ears from side to side, contracted his tongue at his mouth, and five-colored lights emerged to circle his body three times and went out on the top of his head.

source_sentence: 摩納心動喜怖交集，欣然歎曰：「沙門瞿曇真是佛也！
translation: Moved with joy and fear, Māṇḍa joyfully exclaimed, "The ascetic Gautama is really the Buddha!

source_sentence: 相好光明靡不備焉，觀世希有，真可謂如來、應供、正覺，吾當翼從觀尊楷式，以化愚惑并啟吾師。」
translation: There's nothing lacking in beauty and radiance, and it's rare in the world to observe it; it really can be called the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened; I will follow the model of the Bhagavān to convert the foolish and enlighten my teacher."

source_sentence: 即尋世尊處內禪定，周旋教化拯濟眾生，或宿或歸輙與僧俱，未曾隻獨。
translation: He then sought out the Bhagavān's inner meditation retreat, went around teaching and rescuing sentient beings, and whenever he stayed overnight or returned, he would always join the saṃgha, never alone.

source_sentence: 六月之日猶影追身，具覩神化巍巍之德。
translation: On the day of June, he was still being followed by his reflection, fully aware of the majestic virtue of the miraculous transformation.

source_sentence: 稽首佛足辭還本土，到詣師所稽首如舊，就座而坐。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, returned to his native land, went to the master's office, paid his respects as before, took his seat, and sat down.

source_sentence: 師曰：「吾使爾行觀察瞿曇天尊之資、相好神化，審如群儒稱揚之不虛乎？
translation: The teacher said, "I've asked you to practice and observe the Gautama Heavenly Honored One's qualifications, appearance, and miraculous qualities; do you think it's true that they've been praised by various scholars?

source_sentence: 若其然者，吾當馳詣稽首足下，接足戴土之恭。」
translation: If that's the case, I'll march over to bow at his feet and accept his respect with my feet in the earth."

source_sentence: 對曰：「其有相好神德踰天，巍巍難稱，釋梵所不能測度，群聖莫能籌算，眾賢所歎，億載之分未獲其一，非吾螢燭所能盡陳。
translation: They replied, "His features are so beautiful and spiritual that they transcend the heavens and are so lofty and indescribable, they can't be fathomed by the Śakra and Brahmā, can't be calculated by a group of sages, and are admired by many good men.

source_sentence: 略說其要，絕世之相三十有二，一相足下安平正；二相手足有輪，輪有千輻；三相鈎鎖骨；四相長指；五相足跟滿；六相手足細軟，掌內外握；七相手足合中縵；八相鹿[跳-兆+專]腸；九相陰馬藏；十相身色紫金光輝弈弈；十一相身猶金剛，瑕穢寂靜；十二相肌皮細軟，塵水不著身；十三相一一孔一毛生；十四相毛紺青色，右轉盤屈；十五相方身；十六相如師子上身；十七相不曲身如梵身；十八相肩滿具肉連著身；十九相平住兩手摩膝；二十相頰車如師子；二十一相四十齒；二十二相為方齒；二十三相齒間平；二十四相齒白無喻；二十五相廣長舌；二十六相味味次第味；二十七相聲如梵聲；二十八相七合滿起；二十九相眼中白紺青色；三十相眼睫上下眴如牛王；三十一相白毛眉中跱；三十二相頂有肉髻，光明韑韑遏日絕月。
translation: 略說其要，絕世之相三十有二，一相足下安平正；二相手足有輪，輪有千輻；三相鈎鎖骨；四相長指；五相足跟滿；六相手足細軟，掌內外握；七相手足合中縵；八相鹿[跳-兆+專]腸；九相陰馬藏；十相身色紫金光輝弈弈；十一相身猶金剛，瑕穢寂靜；十二相肌皮細軟，塵水不著身；十三相一一孔一毛生；十四相毛紺青色，右轉盤屈；十五相方身；十六相如師子上身；十七相不曲身如梵身；十八相肩滿具肉連著身；十九相平住兩手摩膝；二十相頰車如師子；二十一相四十齒；二十二相為方齒；二十三相齒間平；二十四相齒白無喻；二十五相廣長舌；二十六相味味次第味；二十七相聲如梵聲；二十八相七合滿起；二十九相眼中白紺青色；三十相眼睫上下眴如牛王；三十一相白毛眉中跱；三十二相頂有肉髻，光明韑韑遏日絕月。

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇具有高雅，三十二相無一缺減，神妙之德景則無量，可奇可貴自古希有。
translation: The ascetic Gautama is elegant, has none of the thirty-two marks missing, and has a limitless view of marvelous qualities that are rare and valuable from ancient times.

source_sentence: 「吾覩瞿曇跬步發足，輙先舉右足步，長短遲疾合儀；行時踝膝不相切摩，平身而進肩不動搖；若欲還顧略不以力，平住斯須，忽然後向不迴身也；不低不仰頭身正平，平視而進未嘗顧眄；躇步之儀其為若斯矣。
translation: "When I saw the Gautama take a step, he would always raise his right foot first, making it long and short, slow, and in accord with the proper manners; when he walked, his ankles and knees didn't cut against each other, and he advanced with a level body and unshaken shoulders; if he wanted to look back, he wouldn't use his strength, but he would hold it flat and suddenly turn back without turning around; he wouldn't lower or tilt his head, and his body would be level, and he would advance with a level look without ever glancing at it; such was the manner of the Gautama's steps.

source_sentence: 瞿曇行路，天施寶蓋華下如雪，天龍飛鳥無敢歷上，三界眾生無見頂者；諸天作樂導從奉尊，龍神地祇平治途路高下如砥；足不蹈地輪相印現，光明輝輝煌煌七日乃滅；樹木低仰若人跪拜之禮。
translation: When the Gautama travels, the gods bestow jeweled canopies with flowers like snow, no dragon or bird dares to ascend, and no sentient being in the three realms sees their heads; the gods make merry, guide and follow their venerable masters, the dragons and gods calm the pathway as high and low as whetstone; their feet don't tread on the ground, the wheel marks their appearance, and their light shines brilliantly for seven days before it ceases; the trees are bowed down like a person prostrating in obeisance.

source_sentence: 若行應請，戶楣高下平身而入，楣不高舉瞿曇不伏；坐正中床不侵前後，叉手而坐未嘗指擬，不以拄頰，下床不回忽然在地。
translation: If he's practicing at the invitation of the gods, he enters with his body level at the height of the lintel, doesn't raise the lintel high enough for the Gautama to fall down, sits on the middle of the bed without encroaching on the front or back, sits with his arms folded, doesn't point at anything, doesn't use his cheeks, and gets off the bed without turning around and suddenly falls to the ground.

source_sentence: 天魔含毒而來，心不恐懼光顏更釋，慈心愍之毒無不消。
translation: When Māra comes containing poison, his mind isn't afraid, his radiant countenance is refreshed, and the poison doesn't go away with a compassionate heart.

source_sentence: 以鉢受水，鉢不傾昂水不多少；澡鉢之時，水鉢俱寂不有微聲。
translation: When he takes a bowl of water, the bowl isn't tipped over and the water isn't too much; when he washes his bowl, the water and bowl are both silent, and there's no faint sound.

source_sentence: 未嘗以鉢下著于地，於中澡手手鉢俱淨，去鉢中水高下近遠，適得其所也。
translation: Hasn't he ever put his bowl down on the ground, washed his hands, cleaned his bowl with his hands, and removed the water from the bowl at the right level and near the right place?

source_sentence: 以鉢受飯飯不污鉢，摶飯入口，嚼飯之時三轉即止，飯粒皆碎無在齒間者；若干種味味味皆知，足以支形不以為樂。
translation: When he takes a bowl of rice and doesn't defile it, he puts it in his mouth, chews it three times, and then stops; all the grains of rice crumble without getting between his teeth, and he knows each of the various flavors and tastes well enough to support his form and not take it as pleasure.

source_sentence: 瞿曇受食，以八因緣，不以遊戲，無邪行心，無欲在志，無巧偽行，遠三界塵，令志道寂衣福得度，斷故痛痒塞十二海，滅宿罪得道力，守空寂不想空。
translation: The Gautama accepts the meal for eight reasons, doesn't play with it, doesn't have a mind for wrong behavior, doesn't have desires in mind, doesn't engage in clever and counterfeit behavior, keeps his mind free of the dust of the three realms, makes his intentions quiescent, attains happiness in clothing, stops constipation, stops pain and itching, plugs the twelve seas, extinguishes past sins, attains the power of the path, and observes emptiness and quiescence without thinking about emptiness.

source_sentence: 澡鉢如前。
translation: He washes his bowl as before.

source_sentence: 法衣應器，意無憎愛。
translation: The Dharma robe is suitable for the vessel, and his intentions are not hostile.

source_sentence: 為布施家呪願說經訖還精舍，不向弟子說食好惡；食自消化無大小便利之穢也。
translation: When he returns to the monastery after reciting the sūtras for the almsgiver, he doesn't tell his disciples about the good and bad qualities of food; the food itself is digested, and there's nothing large or small that's convenient or defiled.

source_sentence: 入戶靜默深惟諸定，須臾即出未嘗失時；晝夜不眠亦無睡欠。
translation: He enters his home in silence and deeply contemplates his meditations, and he emerges in a moment without ever losing time; he doesn't sleep day or night, and he has no trouble sleeping.

source_sentence: 廣陳明法勸進弟子令入道堂，不以財色穢道之行示諸弟子。
translation: He explains the teaching in detail, encourages his disciples to enter the hall of enlightenment, and doesn't show them the ways of wealth and form that defile them.

source_sentence: 尊說高遠，非仙聖眾書所可聞見也，興起同處清淨為道。
translation: His teaching is so lofty and far-reaching that it's not something the sages and scholars can hear and see, and he arouses the same place of purity as the path.

source_sentence: 經行之時不顧眄視，頗[我*頁]姿則拂衣披纚，法服在身高下急緩於身雅好；入園洗足亦不摩抆而足自淨。
translation: When he's walking, he doesn't look or glance at himself, and when he's quite [I*page] poised, he brushes his robes and drapes his kerchief, puts his Dharma robe on his body, makes his height rise and fall, and makes himself comfortable, and washes his feet in the garden without mopping them up.

source_sentence: 身色煌煌喻于天金，意不著愛志如虛空。
translation: His body is resplendent and resembles the gold of the sky, and his mind isn't attached to craving; his aspiration is like space.

source_sentence: 「其坐禪定[火*霍]然無想，三毒四痛、五陰六入、七結八瞢，瞢以無上之明消滅之焉。
translation: "When he sits in meditation and concentrates [on fire*horn] with no thoughts, the three poisons, four pains, five aggregates, six sense-fields, seven bonds, and eight obscurations are all vanquished with unsurpassed insight.

source_sentence: 以空、不願、無想之定斷九神處，以十善消十惡，作十二部經，掘十二因緣根，六十二見諸弊惱瘡，穢濁之念心寂然哉。
translation: With the meditation of emptiness, unwillingness, and absence of perception, he stops the nine abodes of the spirit, eliminates the ten evils with ten good qualities, creates twelve scriptures, digs into twelve causal faculties, sees sixty-two ills and sores, and quiets his mind with defiled thoughts.

source_sentence: 以四等大乘自度尊身又濟眾生，欲說景模，弟子未問而先自笑，口中出光明繞身三匝以漸自滅。
translation: He has honored himself with the four great vehicles and has helped sentient beings. When he wants to explain his vision, his disciple laughs before asking about it, and a light rises from his mouth, circles him three times, and gradually extinguishes itself.

source_sentence: 「阿難整服稽首而問，即大說法，聲有八種：最好聲、易了聲、濡軟聲、和調聲、尊慧聲、不誤聲、深妙聲、不女聲。
translation: "When Ānanda was dressed and bowed his head, he gave a great teaching with eight kinds of sounds: a best sound, an easy-to-understand sound, a soft sound, a harmonious sound, a dignified, intelligent sound, a sound that isn't mistaken, a profound, and a sound that isn't feminine.

source_sentence: 言不漏闕，無得其短者。
translation: Nothing is missing from these words, and nothing is too short for them.

source_sentence: 每大說經，二十四天梵釋四王、日月星宿，其中諸神帝王臣民，地祇海龍，皆來稽首各自聽經，經聲入耳心各解了，如其種語也。
translation: Whenever he speaks the sūtras, the twenty-four gods, the four kings of Brahmā, the sun, moon, stars, constellations, gods, emperors, subjects, earth deities, and naval dragons all bow down and listen to the sūtras individually, and the sounds of the sūtras enter their ears and minds, each understanding them just as they are in their various words.

source_sentence: 佛之明慧猶崑崙河，千川萬流皆仰之焉，川流溢滿而河無指渧之減。
translation: The Buddha's insight is like the Kunlun River, where a thousand rivers and ten thousand streams all look up to him, and the river overflows without a single drop falling out.

source_sentence: 佛之為明有踰之矣，眾生受智各得滿足，佛明不虧絲髮之間。
translation: The Buddha's insight is greater than that, and sentient beings receive wisdom that's fulfilled by each, so the Buddha's insight isn't missing between a hair of his head.

source_sentence: 說經訖竟，諸開士尊、諸天帝王、臣民龍鬼靡不欣懌，稽首而退，奉戴執行者也。
translation: When he finished speaking the sūtras, the enlightened ones, gods, emperors, subjects, dragons, and ghosts all rejoiced, bowed their heads, and withdrew, honoring those who carried out the task.

source_sentence: 入裏靖默，未嘗以無上天尊之德，輕慢弟子逮乎眾生。
translation: He entered the room in calm silence, never despising his disciples for the virtue of the unsurpassed gods and catching sentient beings.

source_sentence: 「吾尋瞿曇，六月之間猶影追身，具視起居經行入室，澡漱飯飲呪願說經，勸勉弟子禪定之時。」
translation: "I've been searching for Gautama, and during the past six months I've still been followed by his shadow, fully observing his rising and retreating, walking into his room, washing his food, drinking his curse, vowing to preach the sūtras, and encouraging his disciples to meditate."

source_sentence: 摩納曰：「瞿曇景式容儀若茲，余之所陳，猶以一渧添于巨海，非眾聖心想擬可知，非諸天所能逮畢、天地之所能論，巍巍乎其無上，洋洋乎其無崖，非測非度，難可具陳矣。」
translation: Māṇava said, "Gautama's appearance and bearing are so great that what I've described is like adding a drop to a huge ocean, which cannot be imagined by the minds of the sages, cannot be fully grasped by the gods, and cannot be discussed by heaven and earth; it's so lofty and so vast that it's without cliff, which cannot be fathomed or measured, and which is difficult to describe."

source_sentence: 梵摩渝從弟子聞天師之德，愕然流淚曰：「吾年西垂，殆至徒生徒死，不覩天師之上明矣。」
translation: When Brahmā's disciples heard of the teacher's virtue, they were shocked and wept, saying, "As my years are numbered, I'll probably end up being born and die in vain; I won't see the supreme wisdom of the teacher."

source_sentence: 摩渝喜曰：「吾以遇哉！
translation: Mayu rejoiced, saying, "I've met him!

source_sentence: 覩佛而死，厥榮難云。
translation: When I see a Buddha and die, my glory is hard to fathom.

source_sentence: 愚夫雖有天地之壽，何異乎土石之類哉？」
translation: Although a foolish man has the lifespan of heaven and earth, how is he different from the likes of dirt and stone?"

source_sentence: 即興正服五體投地，三頓首曰：「歸佛、歸法、歸命聖眾。
translation: He then threw his five bodies into the ground in proper attire and bowed his head three times, saying, "I take refuge in the Buddha, in the Dharma, and in the noble ones for their lives.

source_sentence: 願吾殘命有餘，得在覲見稽首稟化。」
translation: May I have a remaining life to go to see them, bow down, and present myself to them for transformation."

source_sentence: 佛以六通之明，覩彼自歸，佛遙受之。
translation: With the Buddha's insight of the six supernormal powers, he saw him take refuge in the Buddha, and the Buddha accepted it distantly.

source_sentence: 自隨提國到彌夷國，坐一樹下。
translation: He went from Śrīti to Mihir and sat under a tree.

source_sentence: 國王臣民、逝心理家，展轉相命曰：「沙門瞿曇！
translation: The king's subjects and the deceased's family took turns commanding each other, saying, "Gautama the ascetic!

source_sentence: 出自釋家帝王之子，宜在奢麗，而今清素志性淡泊，無貪婬之垢、恚怒之毒、愚癡之冥，處眾聖之上，猶星中有月，神德廣被諸天所宗，為如來、應儀、正真覺，穢冥已盡、慧明獨存，神聖富足，未有乾巛其中眾諸，現在十方微著委曲，當來未萌無事不明，吐章施教言皆真誠也。」
translation: He comes from the Śākyas, the sons of the emperor, who should have been in an extravagant place, but now he's pure and simple in mind and nature, unsullied by the stain of craving and lust, the poison of anger, and the obscurity of delusion, sits above the sages like the moon among the stars, has his spiritual virtue widely shared by the gods, is a tathāgata, a yōgi, and a true awakening, has ended defilement and obscurity, has wisdom and insight alone, is rich in gods and sages, has not yet dried up the many of them, and now has subtle attachments and twists in ten directions, has nothing unknown in the future, and exhales the true sincerity of his words in teaching."

source_sentence: 國王群臣、逝心高士，僉然而曰：「我生時哉得覩天師，可尊可戴，應為稽首沐浴神化。」
translation: The king, his ministers, and the senior men who had left his mind all said, "Is there a time in my life when I got to meet a divine teacher who's honorable and honorable, and who should bow down and bathe the gods and transform them?"

source_sentence: 因共會聚，車馬步者，家無遺人。
translation: As a result, they all gathered together, and there were no chariots, horses, or foot soldiers left at home.

source_sentence: 到，有稽首佛足者、跪者、揖讓者、自名字者，皆默而坐。
translation: When they arrived, there were those who bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, those who knelt, those who bowed down, and those who called themselves by their own names, all of whom sat in silence.

source_sentence: 梵摩渝聞佛與聖眾俱到，甚喜無量，率其門徒俱詣佛所。
translation: When Brahmā and his disciples heard that the Buddha and the noble people had arrived, they were overjoyed beyond measure and rushed to the Buddha's place.

source_sentence: 適至林際，意悟念曰：「當先遣人表心致虔，直自進者為不恪乎？」
translation: When he arrived at the forest, his mind was enlightened, saying, "Should we first send someone to express our devotion and ask those who are directly advancing themselves to not scrupulously do so?"

source_sentence: 呼弟子曰：「爾持吾名，稽首佛足下云：『梵摩渝逝心年百二十，飢渴聖摸、樂仰清風，欣懌瞿曇起居常安淡泊無欲。
translation: He summoned the disciple, "Hold on to my name and bow at the Buddha's feet, saying, 'Brahmā Yudhisena is 120 years old, hungry and thirsty for the holy touch, happy to admire the pure air, and happy to meet the Gautama, who always lives in comfort and tranquility without desire.

source_sentence: 今詣請見。』」
translation: Now, I'd like to come and see you.'"

source_sentence: 弟子禮師，即至佛所，稽首畢具陳師請，向佛歎其師曰：「國師梵摩渝，博通眾經貫綜祕讖，靖居齋房豫知天文，圖書吉凶靡不逆照，豫明斯世當有天師，巨容丈六天姿紫金，相有三十二，好有八十章，天中之天眾聖中王。
translation: The disciple paid homage to his teacher, went to the Buddha, paid homage, presented his request, and praised his teacher to the Buddha, saying, "The national teacher Brahmā Yudhisthira is a man who has a thorough knowledge of the scriptures and comprehensive knowledge of the esoteric texts, lives quietly in his abode and knows astronomy, reads fortunes and ill fortune without fail, and knows that there will be a heavenly teacher in this world with a huge body measuring six feet and a heavenly bearing of purple gold, with thirty-two features and eighty beauties, a god among gods and a king among sages.

source_sentence: 今故馳詣歸命三尊，近在林樹之外未敢自進，願欲覲見恭稟神化。」
translation: I've therefore rushed to the three honored ones to pay my respects, but I'm afraid to go beyond the trees, so I'd like to pay my respects and present my charism."

source_sentence: 世尊即曰：「善哉進矣！」
translation: The Bhagavān then said, "Good, you've entered!"

source_sentence: 弟子返命，以佛明教具啟師意，師即稽首于地欣懌而進。
translation: The disciple returned and instructed the teacher with the Buddha's clear teaching, and he bowed his head to the ground and gladly saluted.

source_sentence: 國內逝心長者理家，遙見其師，征營竦慄拱手垂首，梵摩渝曰：「復爾常坐，吾今自坐瞿曇世尊法御之側也。」
translation: When the elder layman Zhixin's family in China saw his teacher from a distance, they were terrified, bowed their hands, and hung their heads.

source_sentence: 即五體投地稽首佛足，恭肅而坐。
translation: He threw his five bodies to the ground, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and sat down respectfully.

source_sentence: 靖默清心熟視佛相，即見佛三十妙相，兩相不現，瞢瞢有疑，稽首于地以偈問曰：「吾梵志經典，　　秘讖記世要，　濁世王名淨，　　后名曰清妙，　太子名悉達，　　容色紫金輝，　身有天尊相，　　忍穢以法御，　無上正真相，　　三十二具不？
translation: Jing silently and with a clear mind, he examined the Buddha's features and saw thirty marvelous features of the Buddha, but they didn't appear, so he was overcome with doubt, prostrated himself on the ground, and asked in a verse, "My Brahmacārī scriptures, the secret scriptures that record the essentials of the world, the turbid king named Jing, the later named Qingmiao, the prince named Siddhârtha, his features purple-gold in color, his body with the features of a goddess, his patience in defiling the Dharma, the unsurpassed correct truth, are the thirty-two complete?

source_sentence: 貞潔陰馬藏，　　無欲可別不？
translation: "Is there no desire to hide a pure soul or horse, or can it be distinguished?

source_sentence: 豈有廣長舌，　　覆面舐耳不？
translation: Does he have a long, broad tongue that covers his face and licks his ears?

source_sentence: 陳法踰眾聖，　　梵釋希聞不？
translation: Does the statement of the Dharma surpass all sages, and is it rare for a Brahmin or a Sanskrit to hear it?

source_sentence: 明導天人師，　　能殄眾疑不？
translation: "Can a wise guide of gods and men quell doubt?

source_sentence: 懷道處世康，　　來世獲仙不？
translation: Wouldn't you attain immortality in the next life if you were to embrace the way and be well-off in the world?

source_sentence: 仙度處泥洹，　　永離三界不？
translation: Will sages pass through nirvāṇa and leave the three realms forever?

source_sentence: 心意識魂靈，　　能滅眾苦不？」
translation: Can the mind, thought, consciousness, and spirit cease all suffering?"

source_sentence: 梵志陳其心所疑，佛具知梵志心疑兩相，即以神足現陰馬藏也，出廣長舌還自覆面，舐左右耳，口中光明照彌夷國，繞身三匝徐還入口，即報之曰：「爾之所問，大士三十二相，吾相具足，無減一焉。
translation: The priest declared his doubts, and knowing fully well the two phases of the priest's doubts, the Buddha then showed them the aggregates and the horse store with his miraculous powers, produced a long, broad tongue that covered his face, licked his right and left ears, shone brightly from his mouth, shone in the land of Miji, circled himself three times, and returned to his mouth.

source_sentence: 吾自無數劫來，行四等心，布施、持戒、忍辱、精進、禪定、智慧，拯濟眾生猶自護身，斷求念空守無想定，心垢除盡無復微曀，習斯行來諸殃悉滅，萬善積著遂成佛身，相好光明獨步三界，永離五道之愚冥，獲無上至尊之明，故號曰佛也。
translation: Since uncountable eons, I've practiced four kinds of mind, namely generosity, discipline, forbearance, diligence, meditation, and wisdom, saved sentient beings while guarding myself, ended longing for mindfulness, kept mindfulness of emptiness, and concentrated on nonconception; the mental defilements were removed, and there were no more subtle obscurations; all the calamities that resulted from this practice ceased; ten thousand good attachments were accumulated, and I then became a buddha; my features and appearance shone brightly as I stepped into the three realms alone; I was permanently freed from the folly of the five paths and attained the supreme insight, which is why I'm called a buddha.

source_sentence: 若有貪婬、恚怒、愚癡之毒，五陰、六衰之冥，絲髮之大餘在心者，佛道不成也。
translation: If someone has the poisons of greed, lust, anger, and folly, the darkness of the five aggregates and six decayers, or the great residue of silken hair in their mind, the Buddha Way won't be realized.

source_sentence: 未有人物逮于今日眾生所念，方來未然無數劫中，委曲深奧有所不知者，即非佛也。
translation: A person who hasn't yet grasped the thoughts of sentient beings today and hasn't yet known anything profound and complicated for countless eons in the future is not a buddha.

source_sentence: 四無所畏、八聲、十力、十八不共法、三十二相、八十種好，不足一事者亦非佛矣。
translation: Someone who doesn't have the four forms of fearlessness, the eight sounds, the ten powers, the eighteen distinctive qualities, the thirty-two marks, or the eighty kinds of beauty is also not a buddha.

source_sentence: 吾今以具，無一不足，故號為佛。
translation: Now, because we have them all and none of them are inadequate, we're called a Buddha.

source_sentence: 沙門得應儀道者，能分一身為十、十為百、百為千、千為萬、萬為無數，又能合無數身還為一身；以指按地，三千大千皆為震動，以其心行得無欲定，故能然也，而況佛乎！
translation: An ascetic who has attained the way of response can divide a body into ten, ten into a hundred, a hundred into a thousand, a thousand into ten thousand, and ten thousand into countless, and can combine countless bodies into one; when he presses his finger to the ground, 3,000 great one-thousand [worlds] all shake, which is possible because his mind's activity is concentrated without desire, so how could it be, much less a buddha?

source_sentence: 佛眉一相之德恒沙可算，眉間之勳難可籌計，豈況盡身之德乎！
translation: The virtue of the Buddha's single eyebrow can be counted in an eternity, and the merit between the eyebrows is difficult to fathom, let alone the virtue of the whole body!

source_sentence: 重曰梵志信佛三尊者，現世安隱終生天上，所欲從念所疑當問，無嫌難也。」
translation: Again, I say, "Brahmā, those who believe in the three honored ones, are secure in the present life and will eventually be born in the heavens, so they should follow their thoughts and ask questions without any difficulty."

source_sentence: 梵志念曰：「瞿曇所說玄妙深遠，盡吾問也。」
translation: The priest thought, "Gautama's teaching is so profound and far-reaching that I've asked about it completely."

source_sentence: 又念曰：「吾今當問現世事耶？
translation: He also thought, "Now, shall I ask about the affairs of the present life?

source_sentence: 來世事耶？」
translation: What are the affairs of the world in the future?"

source_sentence: 意重悟曰：「三世之要唯佛明焉，豈但仙聖群儒之所能照乎？」
translation: He said, "The only one who understands the essentials of the three times is the Buddha, isn't it only the sages and scholars who can illuminate them?"

source_sentence: 梵志曰：「何謂逝心？
translation: The Brahmin said, "What is meant by passing away?

source_sentence: 何謂通達？
translation: What is meant by comprehension?

source_sentence: 何謂為淨？
translation: What is meant by "pure"?

source_sentence: 何謂寂然？
translation: What is meant by quiescent?

source_sentence: 何謂為佛？」
translation: What is meant by a buddha?"

source_sentence: 佛報梵志：「吾以真言啟釋爾意，諦聽著心。
translation: The Buddha rewarded Brahmā, "I've explained your intention with true words and have listened closely to your mind.

source_sentence: 得三神足，謂之逝心。
translation: Attaining the three miraculous abilities, this is called passing away the mind.

source_sentence: 明識往古分別生地，道眼覩見，山石所不能遏，決闇釋疑三世悉明，謂之通達。
translation: To have a clear consciousness that has discerned birth stages in the distant past, seen with the eye of the Way that can't be contained by mountains and rocks, and resolved darkness and released doubt in the three worlds is called penetrating.

source_sentence: 以得六通心垢除盡，謂之寂然。
translation: Attaining the six supernormal powers removes the mental defilement and is called tranquility.

source_sentence: 三毒已滅心如天金，謂之清淨。
translation: Once the three poisons have ceased, his mind is like heavenly gold, which is called pure.

source_sentence: 生死癡本焦盡無餘，清淨道行降于三界，諸癡已索無窮不達，得一切智，尊號為佛也。」
translation: The basis of delusion in birth-and-death is scorched away without remainder, the practice of the pure path descends into the three realms, and once delusion is stifled without limit or comprehension, he attains omniscience and is honored and called a buddha."

source_sentence: 梵志欣然起立，五體投地頭面著佛足，以口嗚佛足，以手摩佛足，復自名曰：「吾是梵摩渝逝心者，歸命佛、歸命法、歸命僧。」
translation: The priest joyfully rose, threw his five bodies to the ground, put his head on the Buddha's feet, saluted the Buddha's feet with his mouth, rubbed his hands on the Buddha's feet, and called himself, "I am Brahmā Yogin, and I give my life to the Buddha, to the Dharma, and to the saṃgha."

source_sentence: 流淚而云：「眾生瞢瞢，為六冥所蔽，覩佛不奉、見經不讀、見沙門無虔愛之心，不稟神化，斯為長衰乎！」
translation: Shedding tears, he said, "All sentient beings are blinded by the six darknesses, don't respect the Buddha when they see him, don't read the sūtras when they see him, don't have a devout heart when they see the ascetics, and don't endow themselves with the spiritual transformation, so this is long-lasting decline!"

source_sentence: 其諸門徒覩師盡虔，顧相謂曰：「吾等尊師，明達經典無書不覩，名被四國眾儒所宗，今者屈尊體，叉手稽首瞿曇足下，何況吾等哉！」
translation: When his disciples saw how reverent their teacher was, they looked at each other and said, "Our venerable teacher, who has a thorough knowledge of the scriptures and has never seen a book that hasn't been written, is well-known among scholars in four countries, and now he bends his body in respect and salutes Gautama with his palms together at his feet, how much more so for us!"

source_sentence: 佛告梵志：「復坐。
translation: The Buddha told Brahmā, "Sit down again.

source_sentence: 吾明爾心，有真信慧，向於世尊。」
translation: I have clarified your mind and have true faith and wisdom, so I'll dedicate it to the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 受教就坐，佛復說持戒之德、布施之福、去家穢濁之垢，歎于道志之上行也。
translation: Accepting the teaching, he sat down, and the Buddha then explained the virtues of observing precepts, the merits of generosity, and the defilement of leaving home, praising him for his superior conduct on the path.

source_sentence: 佛即知梵志有上士歡喜博解之心，佛為說至道之要：「諸苦萬端皆興于身，明人深照知樂者或，返流求原逮于本無，斯謂上士慧明真諦。
translation: Knowing that Brahmā had the mind of a superior person who rejoiced and learned, the Buddha then explained the essentials of the ultimate path, "All the myriad causes of suffering arise in the body, but a learned person who deeply illuminates and knows what's pleasant may go back to the origin and catch the original nothingness, which is called the true truth of a superior person's wisdom and insight.

source_sentence: 不知身之尤苦者，皆由習生；上士覺之，斯明者真諦。
translation: Those who don't know that the body's particular sufferings are all produced by habituation, but when a superior person recognizes them, this is the true truth of insight.

source_sentence: 三界若幻，有合則離，何盛不衰？
translation: The three realms are illusory, and what flourishes and doesn't fade when there's union and separation?

source_sentence: 因緣合則禍生，諸緣離則苦滅，上士觀本乃知其空，斯明者真諦。
translation: When causes and conditions come together, misfortune arises; when they part, suffering ceases, and a superior person observes the root and then knows it's empty, which is the true truth of this insight.

source_sentence: 以知本無即逮三界，空其心、淨其行，不願諸欲得無想定，在心所取，三尊可得也。」
translation: Knowing that the root is nonexistent means he acquires the three realms, empties his mind and purifies his practice, doesn't want desires to attain the concentration without perception, and grasps what's in his mind, and the three honored ones can be attained."

source_sentence: 梵志心解，猶若白[疊*毛]潔無垢穢入染成色；梵志心然，宿命屢奉諸佛、執行清戒，今聞尊教，具解無上正真覺道，心垢寂盡，入三脫門，長離眾苦。
translation: A priest's mind is liberated, just like a white [tuft of *hair] that's clean and undefiled and enters into defiled form; a priest's mind is thus, having repeatedly dedicated his life to the buddhas and carried out pure precepts, he's now heard the teaching of the honored one, fully understands the path of unsurpassed correct and true awakening, tranquilizes the mental defilement, enters the gate of triple liberation, and is free from all suffering for a long time.

source_sentence: 復白佛言：「吾未見佛時，懷巨誤之行，為盲冥所蔽，信狂愚人言以為真諦。
translation: Again, he said to the Buddha, "When I first saw the Buddha, I harbored a great deal of mistaken behavior, was blinded by ignorance, and believed the words of crazy foolish people as the true truth.

source_sentence: 今始覩佛，狂病瘳矣，盲視聾聽、喑語僂申，囹圄囚出矣。
translation: Now that I've seen the Buddha, I've been healed of my crazy illness, and I've been blind, deaf, and dumb, and I've been released from prison.

source_sentence: 庸夫愚惑徒生徒死，不獲懷味天尊真道，長處焰火痛矣奈何？
translation: For those foolish foolish people, they've been born and died in vain, not tasting the true path of the goddess, and they've been living in flames for a long time.

source_sentence: 吾生時哉！
translation: What a time to be born!

source_sentence: 值覩佛極靈，為吾便說至奧之道，令吾復本無為長存。
translation: I've met the Buddha's supreme spirit, who has explained the most mysterious way for me, so that I can again maintain my original aimlessness.

source_sentence: 自今之後，歸佛、歸法、歸比丘僧，願為清信士，守仁不殺、知足不盜、貞潔不婬、執信不欺、盡孝不醉。
translation: From now on, I'll take refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and monks, and vow to be a pure believer who observes kindness and doesn't kill, knows enough and doesn't steal, is chaste and doesn't commit sexual misconduct, adheres to faith and doesn't deceive, and fulfills filial piety and doesn't get drunk.

source_sentence: 天尊哀我，明日晨旦，願與聖眾顧下薄食。」
translation: The Bhagavān sympathized with me, and tomorrow morning at sunrise, I vow to share a meager meal with the noble people."

source_sentence: 佛默受之。
translation: The Buddha accepted it in silence.

source_sentence: 梵志心喜稽首足下，還家具設百味之食。
translation: The priest bowed his head at his feet in joy, and returned to the monk's living quarters to offer him a meal of a hundred flavors.

source_sentence: 即以平旦，於舍為佛作禮，長跪恭白：「願佛以時抂屈尊儀。」
translation: Immediately after sunrise, he paid homage to the Buddha in his abode, knelt down long and respectfully said, "May the Buddha take the time to bend over backwards in respect to his dignity."

source_sentence: 佛正法服，與聖眾俱至梵志家，皆就法坐。
translation: The Buddha correctly dressed himself in the Dharma robe, went with the noble crowd to the house of the priest, and they all took their seats at the Dharma table.

source_sentence: 梵志自手行盥，肅心供養。
translation: The priest himself washed his hands and made solemn offerings.

source_sentence: 如斯七日。
translation: It was like this for seven days.

source_sentence: 佛說神化訖竟，還隨提國。
translation: After the Buddha finished teaching the miraculous transformation, he returned to the country of Śrīti.

source_sentence: 未久之間，梵志壽終。
translation: Not long after that, the priest's life span ended.

source_sentence: 諸比丘聞之，共白佛：「以梵志喪，意將趣何道？」
translation: When the monks heard this, they all said to the Buddha, "What path do you think the priest will take when he dies?"

source_sentence: 世尊曰：「彼梵志者，聖心博解通於不還，五蓋以盡淨若天金，於彼清淨得應真無為而去。」
translation: The Bhagavān said, "That priest, with his noble mind and extensive understanding, is capable of not returning, and he has ended the five hindrances as pure as heavenly gold, where he is purified and attains true nonproductivity and departs."

source_sentence: 佛說經竟，比丘歡喜。
translation: After the Buddha finished speaking the sūtra, the monks rejoiced.

source_sentence: 梵摩渝經
translation: Sutra of Brahmā's Abode
